page.title: 08Military College Shrivenham
page.content: The college was formed in 1716 at Woolwich.The college of Shrivenham and Watchfield was built in 1937,it was used as an artillery barracks.It had only two years of peace before World War 2 broke out.The artillery was shipped out to be used all over the world.When the War ended the artillery never came back.This is when it changed from an artillery barracks to a technical studies college.The reason for this was the war had delayed the advancement of technology so much it had almost stopped.From then until now it has remained the Royal Military College of Science.Nobody is quite sure how much it cost to build,but it cost Vi Count Belisha 12,000 pounds for 600 acres.An interesting fact is Vi Count Belisha invented the Belisha beacons.The college caters for 27
